what a KEWL idea but DON'T DO IT NEXT WEEK please ma'am!!! we'll be gone
and I don't want to miss your pictures :)

Pris

and

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] STOP TOYING W/ MEEEEEEEEEE!!!
messages.msgSnippet: Tell you what I ll do, I m getting a new scanner and when I do I ll scan some pictures in and send them off.  On another list we once did cyber-vacations and
messages.messageBody:
Tell you what I'll do, I'm getting a new scanner and when I do I'll scan
some pictures in and send them off. On another list we once did
cyber-vacations and it was really kewl seeing where everyone else lived and
the fun and educational things to do in their area.

For instance we have Fort Humboldt where U.S. Grant was given the option of
being court marshalled or resigning. Our harbor has made world news
because it is one of the most dangerous to get in and out of in the world.
And stuff like that.

Lynda

----------
> From: Pris <x_t_sipr@...>
> To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
> Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] STOP TOYING W/ MEEEEEEEEEE!!!
> Date: Tuesday, September 05, 2000 9:06 AM
>
>
> OHHHHHHhhhhhh, STOP ... I'm covering my eyes so I can't read anymore of
your
> utopian descriptions ~> LYNDA, STOP TOYING W/ MEEEEEEEEE!!! roflol ...
> that's it, I WANNA MOVE AGAIN!!! would you puleeze e-m me privately the
> name of the city (that is if you'd like, I don't want you feeling like
I'm a
> weirdo or something and WILL understand if you don't fee comfortable w/
> telling me!!!) ... I'm just SO CURIOUS about WHERE you live b/c it sounds
> WONDERFULLLLL PLAYGROUND @ your feet :D
>
> Pris ~> really having JEALOUSY issues this am ... oops, it's time to
leave
> to pick up our food co-op ... more this eve ...
> WARNING: I cannot be help responsible for the above, as apparently my
cats
> have learned how to type ...

> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Lynda" <lurine@...>
> To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, September 05, 2000 10:48 AM
> Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Weather, cold summers
>
>
> >
> > Behind the Redwood Curtain <g> Humboldt County. If your kidlets have
> seen
> > Lost World (the Jurassic Park sequel), then you have seen one of the
> places
> > we go on the weekends to let the kidlets run or watch the elk that roam
> all
> > over in huge herds (we have signs on the freeway for elk crossings as
they
> > litterly life right on the side of the road) or play in the surf.
> >
> > We get lots of fog and rain but can drive out of it. All within an
easy
> > drive we have seven rivers, 2 lakes, five lagoons, about half a million
> > acres in state and national parks, miles and miles of play upon ocean
> > beaches, a bay that is calm enough for kayaking and skulling, a zoo in
the
> > middle of town and rural enough that we have beer, racoons, fox and
> > occasionally a bear that wander through city streets.
> >
> > Lynda
> >
> >
